lightExplanation: Chinese Evergreen supports low light. It thrives best in bright light but no direct sunlight because the leaves will scorch.
waterExplanation: Water your Aglaonema Silver Queen regularly, keep the soil slightly moist during the summer and in the winter the topsoil should be dry out slightly between each watering.
humidityExplanation: This aglaonema can endure less humidity than some other plants, yet it will still appreciate your efforts to improve surrounding humidity levels, either via regular misting or using a pebble tray.
fertilizerExplanation: Fertilize once a month from spring through summer with a balanced houseplant fertilizer diluted by half.
tips: Mist the leaves to increase humidity.
Wipe the leaves with a damp cloth and gently dry to keep them clean and healthy.
Keep it far from cats, dogs and children because it causes mouth irritation.
